description: Application for Minor Material Amendments (S.73) to vary planning condition 2 of planning permission reference 181561FUL dated 06/09/2018 for 'Conversion of existing single dwelling house into five flats; single storey rear extension; and external alterations involving the replacement of existing single glazed timber sash windows with double glazed timber sash windows' Application seeks to allow for the division of the garden into both private and shared amenity spaces and comprises the alteration of proposed first floor windows (rear elevation); together with a deed of variation to the legal agreement.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission 181561FUL dated 6/9/2018.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: , P04A - Proposed Grd and First Floor Plans, P05A - Proposal - Top and Roof Floor Plan and P06A - Proposed Elevation
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies D1 and D2 of the Draft New London Plan 2019; and National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Before the development hereby permitted is brought into use, secure, covered and accessible cycle parking storage spaces shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans outlined in Condition 2. The cycle parking storage shall be fully implemented and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the development provides an appropriate balance of transport options, reduce the likelihood of traffic congestion and does not adversely affect the safety of the road network, in accordance with Ealing's Draft Transport Strategy, policy 1.1 (f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy), the Draft New London Plan (2019) policy T5 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - section 8.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings (eg. living/dining/bath rooms above/ below bedrooms of separate dwelling).  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies D13 of the Draft New London Plan 2019; Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.
| The flat roof of the ground floor rear extension hereby approved shall not be used as a storage area, balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies D1 and D2 of the Draft New London Plan (2019) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
